overview_of_class: Chemistry 102 is the second quarter class of a three-course sequence in General Chemistry. Topics include chemical bonding, intermolecular forces, different phases of matter, solutions, modern materials and nanomaterials, chemical equilibrium, thermodynamics, and nuclear chemistry.
name: General Inorganic Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 102-0-23 General Inorganic Chemistry
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 122-0.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 102 is the second quarter class of a three-course sequence in General Chemistry. Topics include chemical bonding, intermolecular forces, different phases of matter, solutions, modern materials and nanomaterials, chemical equilibrium, thermodynamics, and nuclear chemistry.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 101-0 and Chemistry 121-0.

Students enrolled in this course MUST also enroll in the associated laboratory course, Chem 122-0.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. General Chemistry, Petrucci et al., 11th Edition, Pearson ($338 new; $253.65 used)***
(10th Edition acceptable but content will not match perfectly)

2. Scientific calculator (any model)

***Price as listed by the Norris Bookstore on 4/4/17. Price offered by other vendors may be lower.

class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory
subject: CHEM
